content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 12 Jun 2018How to invest in Astrea bonds? As in I read that it can be done via atm/ibanking but I can't find the option that allows me to do so?3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel ThamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 12 Jun 2018You can only apply through the ATMs or internet banking websites of DBS Bank (including POSB), OCBC Bank and UOB Group. ​And it closes application today 12/6 at 12pm. ​If you are using those banks ibanking, it should be in the same section as IPO shares/Investing0 comments2

Kenneth LouLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 16 Jun 2019Hi there!I was also finding out for my family member who was interested here are the steps:Login to your iBanking appPress on the Electronic Shares application (ESA)Fill in a simple questioniare (risk assessment)Select the ASTREA FUND IPOFill in your details (important your CDP number)Ballot minimum $2,000 in multiples of 1kAttached some images here:0 comments1
MujimoroLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 13 Jun 2019In the DBS digibank app, go to Invest > Electronic securities application (ESA) and select AstreaV.0 comments1
